description: Conversion of part of ground floor of hotel to create ancillary gymnasium and meeting rooms; replacement front and rear entrance canopies/extensions; construction of ground floor rear extension (to provide ancillary office); external alterations.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.3 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The cycle parking indicated on drawing no. 108F (received 29 May 2007) shall be in place prior to occupation of the development hereby approved and retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.   REASON:	To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding: A)	LFNR35 Leq,5mins, for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. B)	LFNR40 Leq,1hr for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby occupiers in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby approved shall be provided with level access to all entrances in accordance with the guidance contained within SPG7: Accessible Ealing, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority (details of which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the works). These measures shall relate to the internal and external areas of the development and shall be in place prior to the occupation of any part of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter, or unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.5, 4.3, 5.3 and 5.7 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 7: Accessible Ealing (SPG7). | The gymnasium permitted shall not be used or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the hotel use known as 'The Holiday Inn'.  REASON:	To ensure that the character of the area is preserved and a separate use is not created, in accordance with policies 1.3 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The gymnasium permitted shall not operate outside 0700 to 2200 hours Monday to Friday, 0800 to 2000 hours on Saturday, Sunday, Bank Holidays and Public Holidays.  REASON:	In the interests of the living conditions of hotel guests, in accordance with policies 1.3 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
